titleStmt.author: Foresee, James D.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Notice of Sale] 1850 Sep. 5 / James D. Foresee
bibl.author: Foresee, James D.
bibl.note: This document is a notice of the sale of a horse and a yoke of oxen, offered by James D. Foresee, sheriff of Humphreys County, and dated September 5, 1850. The items were apparently the property of Jacob M. Wheat but were taken into possession by the Circuit Court of Humphreys County.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
I will offer for sale to the highest bidder for Cash in the Town of Waverly on Monday the 7th day of October next, one brown horse and one yoke of Oxens, levid levied on as the property of Jacob. M. Wheat, at the instant of Richard Batson former clerk and Master of the Circuit Court of Humphreys County, To satisfy a Fi Fa to me directed from the honerable honorable Circuit Court of said County, at its July term 1850, Sale within the house prescribed by law &C, et cetera
September 5th 1850 .
